headline: HPE Expects Revenue Growth to Slow in Next Fiscal Year
summary: The technology company expects revenue to grow between 5% to 10% for fiscal 2026 as it targets higher-growth businesses to improve profit.

raw.headline: HPE Expects Revenue Growth to Slow in Next Fiscal Year

headline: HPE Surprises Wall Street With 2026 Forecast
summary: The server maker, focused on new AI opportunities, forecast weaker-than-expected revenue growth for the coming year. It also boosted its dividend by10%.

raw.headline: HPE Surprises Wall Street With 2026 Forecast
raw.summary: The server maker, focused on new AI opportunities, forecast weaker-than-expected revenue growth for the coming year. It also boosted its dividend by10%.

headline: HPE forecasts fiscal 2026 results below estimates, shares fall
summary: Starting in the first quarter of fiscal 2026, the company will merge its server, hybrid cloud and financial services business segments into a newly created segment: cloud & AI.  HPE is targeting growth in the booming artificial intelligence infrastructure market, as businesses ramp up hardware and software spending to support AI.  "In HPE's new chapter, our strengthened portfolio will create more profitable growth, increasing capital return opportunities that deliver even greater value to our shareholders," CEO Antonio Neri said.

headline: HPE details strategic and execution priorities to drive enhanced shareholder value at HPE Securities Analyst Meeting 2025
summary: NEW YORK, October 15, 2025--HPE (NYSE: HPE) today hosted its Securities Analyst Meeting at the New York Stock Exchange, where Antonio Neri, HPE president and CEO; Marie Myers, executive vice president and CFO; and Rami Rahim, executive vice president, president and general manager of HPE Networking, discussed the company’s strategic priorities and financial outlook through fiscal year 2028. headline: HPE Gains From Server Refresh Cycle: Sign of More Growth?
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise's record Server revenues, powered by AI demand and the global server refresh cycle, point to continued growth momentum into 2026.

headline: A Look at Hewlett Packard Enterprise's Valuation as China Tightens Export Controls on Key Tech Minerals
summary: Fresh export controls from China on key minerals have sparked concern over global tech supply chains, putting Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) in the spotlight as investors assess possible disruptions that could affect the company’s sourcing and operations. See our latest analysis for Hewlett Packard Enterprise. Despite the global supply chain jitters, Hewlett Packard Enterprise’s stock price momentum remains robust, with a 22.85% gain over the past 90 days and total shareholder return of...
